name: Hardening Deeplinks on Custom Dev apps
body:
### Description
**DISCLAIMER: Release builds of your apps are not affected by any of these bugs.** 

We identified and fixed that iOS Custom Dev Apps do not call the correct callback when the app is opened. 

We Identified that Android Custom Dev Apps might crash with the common "Call your administrator" dialog under certain circumstances when Deep Links are used. 

### Improvements
When installing pods (`pod install`) the Native Template is able to derive the XCode version on the system and correctly apply the XCode 12.5 compatibility patch. 

### Fixes
- We identified and fixed an issue on iOS Custom Dev Apps with Deep links.
- We identified and fixed an issue on Android Custom Dev apps with Deep links crashing the application.

name: Fix Android Custom Dev App crash with Deeplinks
body:
### Description
**DISCLAIMER: Release builds of your apps are not affected by this bug.** 

We Identified that Android Custom Dev Apps might crash with the common "Call your administrator" dialog under certain circumstances when Deep Links are used. 

### Fixes 

- We identified and fixed an issue on Android Custom Dev apps with Deep links crashing the application.

name: Add Deep Links support to Custom Developer Apps for Mendx 9 apps
body:
### Improvements

* Custom developer apps now fully support deep links. This allows you to use custom developer apps to test deeplink use cases. For more information, see [How to Create a Custom Developer App](/howto/mobile/how-to-devapps) and [How to Set Up Deep Links in Native Mobile Apps](/howto/mobile/native-deep-link).

### Breaking Change

On iOS, there are now two implementations of `AppDelegate.m.`: one for release apps, and one for developer apps. The more features we added, the more boilerplate we had to add to support the more complex requirements of custom developer apps. By splitting the implementation, release apps now receive a clean and simple implementation with the more complex implementation abstracted away. 

This should make it easier to add custom code by simply following a dependency's documentation. 

Please note that if your app requires custom initialization, for example, due to third-party dependencies, and you plan to test the implementation using custom developer apps, from this version and higher **you must duplicate that custom work** in the AppDelegate (found in `Dev/AppDelegate.m`).**

### Breaking Change

On iOS, there are now two implementations of `AppDelegate.m.`: one for release apps, and one for developer apps. The more features we added, the more boilerplate we had to add to support the more complex requirements of custom developer apps. By splitting the implementation, release apps now receive a clean and simple implementation with the more complex implementation abstracted away. 

This should make it easier to add custom code by simply following a dependency's documentation. 

Please note that if your app requires custom initialization, for example, due to third-party dependencies, and you plan to test the implementation using custom developer apps, from this version and higher **you must duplicate that custom work** in the AppDelegate (found in `Dev/AppDelegate.m`).**

name: Hotfixes for Mendix 8.15.1 and newer
body:
### Fixes

- We fixed an issue with the Firebase module dependencies being automatically linked on the iOS application even when the Firebase capability is disabled.

name: Fix for failing Android builds when using Firebase
body:
### Fixes
A new version of Google Firebase has been released that breaks compatibility with the version used in the the Firebase related pluggable widgets. 

**If you are using Firebase push notifications in your application, update your Native Template to avoid your Android builds failing.**

name: Hotfixes for Mendix 8.15.1 and newer
body:
### Hotfix for v5.1.9

This release fixes a bug with v5.1.9 that could lead to iOS builds failing for no apparent reason.

### Fixes

name: Hotfix for v6.1.3 for Mendix 9
body:
### Hotfix for v6.1.3

- We fixed an issue that was causing iOS builds to fail with Native Template v6.1.3.

### Improvements

The iOS apps should now use a single window and handle scene switching with view controllers instead. This should result in better compatibility in some edge cases.

### Fixes 

- We fixed the App Center scripts to fail early when something is wrong.

name: Improvements for Mendix 9 apps
body:
### Improvements

The iOS apps should now use a single window and handle scene switching with view controllers instead. This should result in better compatibility in some edge cases.

### Fixes 

- We fixed the App Center scripts to fail early when something is wrong.

name: Enabling Mobile Toolkit for Mendix 8.15.1 and newer
body:
### Mobile Toolkit
Mobile Toolkit is a new configuration CLI that we introduced to the Native Template. This way we are moving the responsibility of configuring your project to the Template, allowing off-line users a path to auto configuring their project that previously was impossible due to the online requirement of the Native Mobile Builder. The cli supports a single command:

`native-mobile-toolkit configure --config-path='./config.json'`

or

`npm run configure`

Native Mobile Builder writes to the config.json and commits assets to relative locations. The CLI then reads the config and handles, configuring the projects and moving any assets to the right locations for the projects.

### Fixes

- We fixed another case where Firebase might crash the Custom Developer app when enabling debug mode.

### Fixes

name: Dependency management for Mendix Studio Pro 9.0.3 Beta
body:
### Dependency Management
With this release Native Template supports the newly introduced Native Dependency management system released with Mendix Studio Pro 9.0.3 in conjunction with Mendix Native Mobile Builder.

Native widgets and JS actions can now define their Native Dependencies. Mendix Native Mobile Builder, collects the dependencies and sets up your Native Template with exactly the dependencies that are needed. 

### Mobile Toolkit
Mobile Toolkit is a new configuration CLI that we introduced to the Native Template. This way we are moving the responsibility of configuring your project to the Template, allowing off-line users a path to auto configuring their project that previously was impossible due to the online requirement of the Native Mobile Builder. The cli supports a single command: 

`native-mobile-toolkit configure --config-path='./config.json'` 

or 

`npm run configure`

Native Mobile Builder writes to the config.json and commits assets to relative locations. The CLI then reads the config and handles, configuring the projects and moving any assets to the right locations for the projects. 

### Fixes 
- Target SKD reverted to 29 to support legacy storage on Android API 30
- Reverted Android Gradle Plugin version to 4.0.2 to fix a short coming of App Center and version 4.1.x
- Updated the React Native Device Info library to fix security issues
- Patched React Native Image Picker to fix an issue with duplicate images on Android.

name: Support for Mendix Studio Pro 9
body:
### Description
Mendix Studio Pro 9 and Mendix Studio 9 give you powerful new tools to enhance your apps. For the full list of changes, see the Studio Pro 9 and Studio 9 release notes. With Native template 6.0.0 we add support for Mendix Studio Pro 9 Native Mobile development.

### Highlights
- Upgraded core dependencies.
- Better push notification support. Local notifications do not require Firebase to be setup and work out of the box.

name: New Capabilities support
body:
### Disclaimer

This release is required to use the Capabilities support introduced with the new Mendix Native Mobile Builder. As long as you have not updated you won't be able to make use of that functionality in the tool.

### Capabilities support

With the release of Mendix Native Mobile Builder, included when installing Mendix Studio Pro 8.15 or later, we are introducing a new approach in linking dependencies. 

While previous versions  of Native Template would have all core dependencies linked by default; for example an app would have Firebase even though it is not using any functionality; with the new approach we are building on top of React Native's auto linking behaviour and extending it a step further.

We gathered all core functionalities and grouped them under the platform specific `capabilities.*.json`  files. With a simple boolean toggle Native Template is able to link the required dependencies for the enabled capability, even the non auto-linkable ones. This happens as part of the pod installation for iOS and building on Android. After each change to this files remember to run `pod install` and build your Android project, so that the new files can be generated.

Some steps, like the inclusion of the Google Service configuration, or the google map api, are still manual, if you are building locally.
If you would like to further simplify these steps consider using the Mendix Native Mobile Builder to just configure your project and build your project however you like.

name: Extending capabilities support
body:
### Breaking change
While playing with our new capabilities support we identified some shortcomings.
In the initial implementation we thought of both platforms as a single configuration. "Less is more" they say, but in this particular case, less was too limiting. Therefor this update brings the splitting of the `capabilities.json` file to two new files, `capabilities.android.json`, and `capabilities.ios.json`. This allows the toggling of capabilities as needed for each platform.

#### What does that mean for Native Mobile Builder users: 
If you are using the Native Mobile Builder. Make sure you are using 0.9.x or later and there's nothing to fear, the builder will take care of things when re-building your project.

#### What does that mean for advance tinkerers:
If you are building locally, keep in mind that for enabling the needed capabilities the respective files for each platform need to be modified.
In addition, **on iOS**,  you will need to run `pod install`, as code generation is a sub-step of the pod installation flow. 

### Push notification support for Native Mobile Builder
On top of that functionality, we introduced Push Notifications support with just a few clicks. 

Jump into the Capabilities page and enable Push Notifications. Setup your Google Service configuration files, build and the new app should have Push Notifications configured.

**Offline tinkerers**
Enable the push notification capability for the platform you want by editing the appropriate `capabilities.*.json`, add the Google Service configuration file for each platform as advised by the platform's documentation and you are good to go.

### Improvements
- Added support for XCode 12.
- Added missing iPad icons, that would lead to apps being rejected when committed to TestFlight.
- Enabled legacy storage support to allow for some failing file operations to work correctly on Android 10 and later.
- Fixed a bug in our generator logic, that would lead to local Android builds to fail when running on Windows.

name: Comply with targetSDK 29 requirement for Google Play for Mendix Studio up to 8.12
body:
As of August 2020 Google Play requires apps to be build targetting SDK 29. This version of the Native Template complies with these requirements.

**More info**: https://support.google.com/googleplay/android-developer/answer/113469#targetsdk

**More info**: https://support.google.com/googleplay/android-developer/answer/113469#targetsdk

name: Better splash screen support
body:
### Notice
Mendix Studio Pro 8.12.1 introduces better splash screen support for Native Apps. As the new functionality requires new native dependencies the changes are not backward compatible with previous Mendix Studio versions.

### Improvements
In the first implementation, splash screens were static resources controlled by the native side of the app. While good enough in simple cases; they are inadequate for longer syncing sessions; where the splash screen could toggle off too soon.

With the new implementation, splash screens are fully togglable via the client. That means that the client has full control over the splash screen. That translates to better on/off timing and less missed frames for longer syncing sessions.

name: Bug fixes
body:
## Fixes 

- Mitigated the Gradle Java out of memory issue when building on App Center due to App Center's recent changes.
- We added an error message to iOS for when the Bundle or the Runtime URL is missing. 
- Fixed an issue with styling Text Fields on Android when both a margin and height was defined.

name: Fix for iOS device orientation issues
body: This release fixes an issue where the root view will not resize correctly when switching between device orientations.

name: Support for Mendix Studio Pro 8.10 features
body:
New Features: 

### Support for Mendix Studio 8.10 synchronization fixes for Custom Developer Apps
Prior to 8.10, Custom Developer Apps had to do a full session data request with each reload, slowing down the developer experience tremendously. 
From 8.10 onwards the client is able to tell when and what to sync. This behavior should emulate incremental syncs better and more consistently.

### Fixes 
* We removed the complimentary libraries for the Camera module that were added with the 4.0.0 release and that made Firebase a mandatory dependency when any camera functionality was used of iOS.

name: Mendix Studio Pro 8.9 support
body:
This is the release supporting Studio Pro 8.9 and onwards. This release includes a major upgrade of the included dependencies which renders it incompatible with previous versions of Studio Pro. 

**Please upgrade with caution, only if you are upgrading your project to Studio Pro 8.9.**

name: Removal of UIWebView pt.2
body: * We removed unused UIWebview references from the base framework that could trigger the App Store warning

name: Removal of UIWebView
body:
With this release, we are removing the UIWebView from our codebase. This is in compliance with Apple's App Store requirements for releasing new apps.

### This release is compatible with Mendix Studio Pro 8.8 and later and is required to release new Apps on the App Store from 1st of April.

name: Android enhancements
body:
* We fixed a memory issue. The Android template now uses use a larger heap by default to accommodate for memory-heavy tasks.
* We fixed an issue where the Android app crashed when the maps widget was used but the API key had not been configured yet. The Android app no longer crashes in this case.

name: Fix OTA not working on iOS
body: - We identified and fixed an issue with OTA on iOS

name: Fixing images not syncing on iOS
body:
**When updating from v3.1.0 a rebuild of the iOS app is required.**

### Fixes

* On iOS dynamic images should again be synced correctly to the device.

name: Objective-C rewrite
body:
## Please update to v3.1.1 to avoid an iOS bug with file syncing.

### Improvements

* The MendixNative library and [Native Template](https://github.com/mendix/native-template) are now written in Objective-C. Besides being more aligned with the whole React Native ecosystem, with this update, we are further closing the gap between the Native Template and the React Native starter template. Now that they are more aligned, we can work on supporting new React Native features like [autolinking](https://github.com/react-native-community/cli/blob/master/docs/autolinking.md) as we upgrade to newer versions of React Native.

* The Native Template now supports push notifications. As soon as you include a Google services configuration file (GoogleService-Info.plist* and *google-services.json* in your app, the Native Template will enable the required libraries automatically.

* Added support for URL Schemes.

### Fixes

* Bridging Headers should now work as intended and not collide when building.
* Swift compiler incompatibilities should not occur anymore with new versions of XCode.
* React Native link command should now work as intended for both platforms.

name: Custom Developer Apps
body: With this release, we officially added support for generating custom developer applications per Mendix App and per Studio Pro versions.

name: Better keyboard avoiding behavior on iOS
body:
### Improvement

* Introduced a more consistent keyboard-avoiding behavior on iOS.

### Breaking Change

* The new keyboard-avoiding behavior may introduce visual artifacts for apps built against Mendix Studio Pro versions earlier than 8.5.0.

name: SVG Support
body:
With this release, we officially added support for the SVG in Mendix apps. 
In addition, a number of fixes have been applied.

Android: 
* Fixed an issue that would not allow apps to work in offline mode
* Updated SVG library
* Added all required but missing permissions

iOS 
* Fixed a configuration issue that would make Firebase a mandatory requirement for the Barcode Scanner functionality
* Compiled libraries for XCode 11.2.1 and latest Swift version

name: Support for Developer Mode
body:
* Include support for developer mode
* Removed RNFirebase package as this breaks remote debugging when not configured
* Disable development-mode handler in release mode

name: A New Beginning
body:
- Added support for Dark theme and Dark Mode for Android 10 and iOS 13 respectively
- Added Over-the-air updates support
- Migrated iOS project to Xcode 11
- Switch App Center build platform to standard ReactNative

name: Stabilise Native dependencies for Android and iOS
body:
- Make sure to pin risky modules to specific versions
- Lock device rotation to portrait only
- Introduce project-based App Center build configurations
- Fix reload handler for Android
- Fix jitpack.io dependency repository

name: Fix iOS static images missing after build
body: Images are now correctly extracted to `Bundle/assets/img`

name: Fixed an issue where small splash screens could affect the android window viewport
body: - We identified and fixed an issue where a smaller than than the display resolution splash screen would break the viewport of the app

name: Fix Appcenter failing when the project has no resources
body: - Fixed an issue where projects with no resources would crash the Appcenter build

name: Official release of the Native Template
body: Official release of the Native Template with support for Mendix Studio Pro 8.0.
